com.paypal.selion.platform.html

Class SelectList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.platform.html.AbstractElement
      • com.paypal.selion.platform.html.SelectList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clickable, Deselectable, Hoverable, Selectable

    public class SelectList
extends AbstractElement
implements Selectable, Deselectable
    This class is the web element Select wrapper.

    In this class, the method 'select' is encapsulated to select option against the specified element.

        public SelectList(String locator)
        SelectList Construction method

        Usage: 
         private SelectList selShippingService = new SelectList("//select[@id='shipping']")
        Parameters:
        locator - - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).

      • SelectList

        public SelectList(String locator,
          String controlName)
        Use this constructor to override default controlName for logging purposes. Default controlName would be the element locator.
        Parameters:
        locator - - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        controlName - the control name used for logging

      • SelectList

        public SelectList(ParentTraits parent,
          String locator)
        Use this constructor to create a SelectList contained within a parent.
        Parameters:
        parent - - A ParentTraits object that represents the parent element for this element.
        locator - - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).

      • SelectList

        public SelectList(String locator,
          String controlName,
          ParentTraits parent)
        Use this constructor to create a SelectList contained within a parent. Use this constructor to override default controlName for logging purposes. Default controlName would be the element locator.
        Parameters:
        locator - - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        controlName - the control name used for logging
        parent - - A ParentTraits object that represents the parent element for this element.

    • Method Detail

      • select

        public void select(String optionLocator)
        Selects an option using optionLocator. Locator must be prefixed with one of the following:
      • label=
      • value=
      • index=
      • id=
Parameters:
optionLocator - the select list option locator

  • select

    public void select(String[] optionLocators)
    Selects an option using a String array of optionLocators. Each locator must be prefixed with one of the following:
  • label=
  • value=
  • index=
  • id=
Parameters:
optionLocators - the select list option locators

  • addSelection

    public void addSelection(String optionLocator)
    Does the same thing as select(String)
    Parameters:
    optionLocator - the option locator to select

  • selectByValue

    public void selectByValue(String value)
    Select all options that have a value matching the argument.
    Parameters:
    value - the value to select

  • selectByLabel

    public void selectByLabel(String label)
    Select all options that display text matching the argument.
    Parameters:
    label - the label to select

  • selectByIndex

    public void selectByIndex(int index)
    Select the option at the given index. This is done by examing the "index" attribute of an element, and not merely by counting.
    Parameters:
    index - the index to select

  • selectByValue

    public void selectByValue(String[] values)
    Select all options that have a value matching any arguments.
    Parameters:
    values - the values to select

  • selectByLabel

    public void selectByLabel(String[] labels)
    Select all options that display text matching any arguments.
    Parameters:
    labels - the labels to select

  • selectByIndex

    public void selectByIndex(String[] indexes)
    Select the option at the given indexes. This is done by examing the "index" attribute of an element, and not merely by counting.
    Parameters:
    indexes - the indexes to select

  • getSelectOptions

    public String[] getSelectOptions()
    Returns all options currently selected.
    Returns:
    All options currently selected.

  • getSelectedLabel

    public String getSelectedLabel()
    Get a single selected label. If multiple options are selected, then the first one is returned.
    Returns:
    A single selected label.

  • getSelectedValue

    public String getSelectedValue()
    Get a single selected value. If multiple options are selected, then the first one is returned.
    Returns:
    A single selected value.

  • getSelectedLabels

    public String[] getSelectedLabels()
    Gets multiple selected labels.
    Returns:
    All selected labels.

  • getSelectedValues

    public String[] getSelectedValues()
    Gets multiple selected values.
    Returns:
    All selected values.

  • getContentLabel

    public String[] getContentLabel()
    Get all labels, whether they are selected or not.
    Returns:
    All labels, selected or not.

  • getContentValue

    public String[] getContentValue()
    Get all values, whether they are selected or not.
    Returns:
    All values, selected or not.

  • deselectAll

    public void deselectAll()
    Clear all selected entries. This is only valid when the SELECT supports multiple selections.
    Throws:
    UnsupportedOperationException - If the SELECT does not support multiple selections

  • deselectByValue

    public void deselectByValue(String value)
    Deselect all options that have a value matching the argument.
    Parameters:
    value - the value to deselect

  • deselectByIndex

    public void deselectByIndex(int index)
    Deselect the option at the given index. This is done by examing the "index" attribute of an element, and not merely by counting.
    Parameters:
    index - the index to deselect

    Parameters:
